newsitem.title: USA: Northrop picks Alabama area for production.
newsitem.headline: Northrop picks Alabama area for production.

text.p: Northrop Grumman Corp on Friday said it selected Huntsville as the area where it would manufacture a new type of anti-armor weaponry for the U.S. Army.

Northrop Grumman, the prime contractor on the BAT program, said several sites in the Huntsville area, including the Army's Redstone Arsenal, were under consideration. A decision is expected later this year, the company said.
The Huntsville area was chosen because the Redstone Arsenal is located there and it has a skilled workforce, Northrop said.

An initial production contract for the unpowered gliders that seek tanks and armored vehicles is expected early next year, the company said. About 40 people are expected to be working on the program during the initial production phases, Northrop said.
The Army plans to buy more than 19,000 of the weapons during the next 10 years, Northrop said. Peak employment is expected to reach about 150 workers by 2004, Northrop said.
